greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation t->t+2 of Z, folded to N.
comment: Corresponds to simple periodic asynchronic site swap pattern ...222222... (holding a ball in each hand forever).
This permutation consists of just two infinite cycles.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Joe Buhler and R. L. Graham, Juggling Drops and Descents, Amer. Math. Monthly, 101, (no. 6) 1994, 507 - 519.
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,-1).
formula: Let f: Z -> N be given by f(z) = 2z if z>0 else 2|z|+1, with inverse g(z) = z/2 if z even else (1-z)/2. Then a(n) = f(g(n)+2).
a(n) = 4*(-1)^n+n for n>3. a(n) = a(n-1)+a(n-2)-a(n-3) for n>6. - _Colin Barker_, Mar 07 2014
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(3 x^5 - 3 x^4 + 4 x^3 - 8 x^2 + 2 x + 4)/((x - 1)^2 (x + 1)), {x, 0, 100}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 08 2014 *)
xref: Row 2 of A065167. Inverse permutation: A065169.
